Dear David:
    But I have integrated Intel Fortran compiler into Visual Studio? 
Must I use Compaq Visual Fortran? By the way, I cannot find the 
binary version for windows: the file Cantera-1.4.win32-py2.2.exe only 
installs a python interface and the file Cantera14.msi only contains 
some examples. Could you tell me where I can find binary Cantera 
libraries? Thanks.
    Also there is some problems with the source distribution. It 
seems you forgot to copy necessary header files into the 
folder "cantera-1.4\include\kernel". I found all these header files 
have been placed into another folder "cantera-1.4\Cantera\src".
Best Regards
Luo Guo

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@c...> wrote:
> Luo,
> 
> To build Cantera on Windows, you need both Microsoft Visual C++ 
and  
> Compaq Visual Fortran, The library dfor.lib comes with Visual 
Fortran.
> Alternatively, you can install the binary version for Windows.
> 
> Dave
> 
> 
> On Monday, June 9, 2003, at 03:38 AM, gluo2003 wrote:
> 
> > Dear David:
> >     I have downloaded the Cantera 1.4 package and have tried
> > installing it under Windows 2000. However, I cannot find
> > the "dfor.lib" which is required when building the 
project "example".
> > Could you please tell me what I should do? Thanks!
> > Best Regards
> > Luo Guo
